Published Host

To become a host on HomeStay, you need to:

  1. Create an account on our platform
  2. Complete your profile with accurate information
  3. Submit your property details and photos
  4. Pass our verification process
  5. Set your availability and pricing

Once approved, you can start accepting travelers and sharing your culture!

Tags: hosting verification profile

Published Traveler

When packing for your homestay experience, consider the following:

  • Weather-appropriate clothing for your destination
  • Personal toiletries and medications
  • Travel documents (passport, visa, etc.)
  • Small gifts from your home country for your host family
  • Adapter plugs for electronic devices
  • Books or other entertainment for downtime

Remember to check with your host about specific items you might need for your stay.

Tags: packing travel preparation

Draft Payment

Payments on HomeStay are processed securely through our platform:

  1. Travelers make payments through our secure payment system
  2. Funds are held in escrow until the stay is completed
  3. Hosts receive payment 24 hours after check-out
  4. We support various payment methods including credit cards and PayPal

Our secure payment system ensures both hosts and travelers are protected.

Tags: payment security escrow

Published Safety Featured

HomeStay takes safety seriously and implements several measures:

  • Identity verification for all users
  • Secure messaging system within the platform
  • 24/7 customer support for emergencies
  • Host and traveler reviews and ratings
  • Secure payment system with escrow protection
  • Safety tips and guidelines for both hosts and travelers

We recommend always communicating through our platform and following our safety guidelines.

Tags: safety verification security
